headerSubtitle: Help scientists by reporting what you experienced during an earthquake.
locationSubtitle: Your current location is automatically detected for accuracy.
locationError: Failed to get location. Please enable location services.
intensitySubtitle: Choose the level on the Modified Mercalli Intensity scale that best describes your experience.
detailsSubtitle: Provide a written description and up to two photos of what you observed.
textReportPlaceholder: e.g., 'The ground shook for about 10 seconds. Pictures on the wall were tilted.'
alertSubmit: Please select an intensity and ensure location is available.
exportSubtitle: Download the collected data in your preferred format.
shpTooltip: SHP file generation is complex and typically requires a server-side process.
mmi_1_desc: Not felt, detected only by instruments.
mmi_2_desc: Felt by a few people at rest.
mmi_3_desc: Felt indoors, like a light truck passing.
mmi_4_desc: Windows, doors rattle. Sensation like a heavy truck striking building.
mmi_5_desc: Felt outdoors; small unstable objects displaced.
mmi_6_desc: Felt by all, some damage to plaster or chimneys.
mmi_7_desc: People run outdoors. Damage to weak buildings.
mmi_8_desc: Damage to ordinary buildings, heavy furniture overturned.
mmi_9_desc: General panic. Serious damage to buildings.
mmi_11_desc: Few structures remain standing. Bridges destroyed.
mmi_12_desc: Total destruction. Objects thrown into the air.
